newsitem.title: USA: Senators seek action on Philippines pork imports.
newsitem.headline: Senators seek action on Philippines pork imports.

text.p: A group of 22 senators Thursday urged the U.S. Ambassador to the Philippines, Raul Rabe, to pursue Manila's compliance with international trade laws to permit more imports of poultry and pork.

Sen. Bob Kerrey, Democrat of Nebraska, said he and 21 others of both parties made the request in a letter to Rabe and said the lack of compliance, over two years, could result in "unfavorable tariffs."
The letter stated that the Philippines was urged to permit processors, traders, hotels and restaurants to buy more U.S. pork and poultry, up to the full quota.
